latest news.eng_title: Rospotrebnadzor Recommends Isolating Individuals Who Have Come into Contact with Monkeys Infected with Smallpox
latest news.summary: The Rospotrebnadzor recommends isolating individuals who have come into contact with monkeys infected with smallpox for three weeks. The document, published on the Rospotrebnadzor website, states that 'in order to prevent the complication of the epidemic situation with monkeypox in the Russian Federation, it is necessary to <...> increase measures to identify individuals with symptoms that do not exclude monkeypox, who have arrived from epidemicically unfavorable countries, to provide a thorough collection of epidemiological anamnesis of individuals who have sought medical help with symptoms that do not exclude monkeypox, first of all those who have arrived from abroad within 21 days.' Additionally, the Rospotrebnadzor recommends organizing informational and methodological work with doctors of all specialties on the diagnosis of monkeypox.
latest news.title: Роспотребнадзор рекомендовал изолировать контактировавших с больными оспой обезьян

latest news.eng_title: 11 mpox cases reported this year with no new virus strain

Organization: Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency

latest news.summary: South Korea has reported 11 mpox cases this year, all of which were the less deadly Clade II variant. The Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA) has bolstered screening at borders to cope with the potential influx of the deadly new variant. The agency noted that mpox is unlikely to be transmitted through everyday activities and asked the public to maintain basic sanitary measures. According to the KDCA, 'As mpox is a disease that can be prevented and treated, we believe that the outbreak can be managed stably under the current system.' The government will continue to monitor for the possible influx of variants from overseas. Arrivals who have visited eight African nations are required to report to officials if they exhibit symptoms related to mpox. The KDCA has redesignated mpox as an infectious disease subject to border screening.
latest news.title: 11 mpox cases reported this year with no new virus strain

latest news.eng_title: Could mpox become established in the Indo-Pacific?
latest news.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared mpox a public health emergency of international concern due to the rapid spread of the virus and its potential for severe health impacts. Cases of mpox have been detected in Sweden, Pakistan, and the Philippines, and the more virulent clade 1b subtype has been detected in Sweden, the first time outside of Africa. The WHO is stressing that we know more about this virus and how it spreads than we did about COVID-19. Mpox is an infectious disease caused by the monkeypox virus, which belongs to the orthopoxvirus genus. The virus can be spread through human-to-human contact, respiratory droplets, fomites, and animal-to-human transmission. The epidemiology of mpox has shifted since the outbreak in May 2022, with a marked increase in cases reported among men who have sex with men. The clinical presentation of mpox includes symptoms such as fever, lymphadenopathy, and characteristic skin lesions. People with mpox can only transmit the disease when they are showing symptoms. The WHO's designation of mpox as a public health emergency underscores the urgency of addressing the disease's potential for rapid spread, particularly in populations with low immunity due to the end of smallpox vaccination programs. The recent emergence of the more virulent clade 1 strain of mpox raises significant concerns about its potential to escalate into a global pandemic, particularly in the Indo-Pacific region. Current treatment options include vaccination strategies, which differ between the two primary clades of mpox, and antiviral treatments such as tecovirimat, which have been found to be ineffective. The most effective strategy right now is to send mpox vaccines to Africa to try and stop the disease from spreading.
latest news.title: Could mpox become established in the Indo-Pacific?

latest news.eng_title: Mexico Does Not Register Cases of Lethal Mpox Variant

Organization: National Network of Public Health Laboratories

latest news.summary: Mexico's Ministry of Health reported that the country has not registered cases of the most lethal and rapidly spreading variant of Mpox (monkeypox), known as clade 1b. The confirmed cases in Mexico correspond to the clade II variant, identified in 2022, and as of August 10, 2024, there have been 53 cases, mostly in Mexico City. The World Health Organization (WHO) issued a global health emergency on August 14, 2024, due to the spread of the clade 1b variant and asked countries to strengthen their epidemiological surveillance systems. In response, Mexico has maintained active the National Network of Public Health Laboratories for the detection of this virus. Since 2022, Mexico has reported a total of 7,385 suspected Mpox cases, of which 4,130 have been confirmed. The majority of current cases are concentrated in men, with Mexico City leading the statistics with 32 cases. Despite the recent increase in cases in other countries, the Ministry of Health emphasized that the most dangerous variant has not been detected in Mexico, reflecting the effectiveness of the implemented surveillance and control measures. However, the alert is maintained and the population is urged to stay informed and follow health recommendations to prevent the spread of the virus.
latest news.title: México No Registra Casos de Variante Letal de Mpox

latest news.eng_title: Health Authorities Conduct Mpox Surveillance in Querétaro
latest news.summary: The Secretariat of Health (SESA) in Querétaro announced that the National Committee for Epidemiological Surveillance (CONAVE) has issued an epidemiological alert regarding mpox, formerly known as monkeypox. The alert aims to have medical units across the country monitor and report suspected cases to reduce transmission chains and provide timely medical attention to affected individuals. CONAVE has reinstated operational definitions of probable, confirmed, and discarded cases based on World Health Organization (WHO) recommendations. Additionally, it outlines actions for healthcare personnel to take when identifying a suspected case. Mexico has a mpox surveillance system, which allows for the notification of suspected cases through the National Epidemiological Surveillance System platform. As of now, no cases of the new clade 1b variant have been reported in the country. In Querétaro, the last confirmed case was reported in February 2023. Continuous epidemiological surveillance is being conducted in first- and second-level healthcare units. Between January 1 and August 5, Mexico's surveillance system identified 49 confirmed cases, distributed across 11 federal entities, all belonging to the clade II variant detected in 2022.
latest news.title: Autoridades de salud realizan vigilancia de viruela símica en Querétaro Expreso Querétaro

latest news.eng_title: Hirving Lozano to Leave PSV Eindhoven for San Diego in 2025
latest news.summary: The Mexican Hirving Lozano will leave the PSV Eindhoven at the end of the season to join the San Diego of the MLS in 2025. Meanwhile, the Mexican Ministry of Health reported that there have been no cases of the more lethal and rapidly spreading clade 1b of Mpox (monkeypox) in the country, and the confirmed cases belong to the clade II, identified in 2022. The World Health Organization (WHO) issued an emergency alert on August 14, 2024. Additionally, various news articles are mentioned, but none of them are directly related to the main topic of the article. The article also mentions the upcoming return to classes in Morelia, but it is not clear how it is related to the rest of the article.
latest news.title: Previo al regreso a clases, se reporta una alta afluencia en la terminal de autobuses de Morelia Milenio

latest news.eng_title: Mexico Reports No Cases of Lethal Mpox Variant
latest news.summary: The Mexican Ministry of Health reported that there have been no cases of the more lethal and rapidly spreading clade 1b of Mpox (monkeypox) in the country. The confirmed cases are of the clade II variant, identified in 2022. According to the National Epidemiological Surveillance System, there have been 53 cases of Mpox (clade II) reported in Mexico as of August 10, with 51 of them in men. The majority of cases have been reported in the Mexico City (32), followed by Quintana Roo (8), Jalisco (3), and other states. In comparison, there were 285 cases of monkeypox reported in the same period in 2023. The World Health Organization declared a public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC) for Mpox in July 2022, which was terminated in May 2023. In Mexico, there have been 7,385 reported cases of Mpox since 2022, with 4,130 confirmed.
latest news.title: Afirma Secretaría de Salud: México no ha registrado casos de variante letal de Mpox Vanguardia.com.mx

latest news.eng_title: Mexico Reports No Cases of Lethal Mpox Variant, Confirms 53 Cases of Clade II

Event: Public Health Emergency of International Concern

latest news.summary: According to the Mexican Ministry of Health, no cases of the more lethal and rapidly spreading Mpox variant (clade 1b) have been registered in the country. The confirmed cases are of the clade II variant, identified in 2022. As of August 10, there have been 53 reported cases of Mpox (clade II) in Mexico, with 51 of them in men. The majority of cases have been reported in the Mexico City (32), followed by Quintana Roo (8), Jalisco (3), and other states. In comparison, during the same period in 2023, there were 285 reported cases of Mpox. The World Health Organization declared an emergency due to a significant increase in cases in the Democratic Republic of Congo and several African countries on August 14. However, Mpox was previously declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) in July 2022, which was terminated in May 2023.
latest news.title: México no ha registrado casos de variante letal de Mpox, asegura SSa

latest news.eng_title: Philippines says recent mpox case is mild Clade 2 variant
latest news.summary: The Philippines has reported its first mpox case this year, a mild Clade 2 variant. According to Health Secretary Teodoro Herbosa, 'The mpox we found was the original variety and probably it could have been circulating in our community.' The patient, a 33-year-old Filipino male, is recovering in hospital. All nine previously infected Filipinos had also recovered. The World Health Organization declared mpox a global public health emergency due to an outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo, which has spread to neighboring countries. The disease leads to flu-like symptoms and pus-filled lesions, and is usually mild but can be fatal for certain groups, including children, pregnant women, and people with weakened immune systems.
latest news.title: Philippines says recent mpox case is mild Clade 2 variant

news knowledge.eng_title: Thailand Confirms First Case of New Mpox Variant in Asia
news knowledge.summary: Thailand has confirmed its first case of the new mpox variant (clade Ib) in Asia, a 66-year-old European patient who arrived in the country on August 14 from Africa. The patient's laboratory results confirmed that they are infected with the new variant. According to the Thai Department of Disease Control, none of the 43 close contacts of the patient have shown symptoms, such as fever, skin eruptions, and swollen lymph nodes, and they will continue to monitor the patient's condition for 21 days. The confirmation of the case in Thailand is the first in Asia since the global outbreak declared by the World Health Organization (WHO), following the detection of other variants in Pakistan and the Philippines. Thongchai Keeratihattayakorn, the head of the Thai Department of Disease Control, urged to strengthen measures to control the spread of the disease, including through close contact with patients, and stated that the results will be sent to the WHO as per protocol. He also ordered the reinforcement of controls at entry points to the country, particularly at Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok, for passengers arriving from countries where cases have been reported. The WHO declared a public health emergency of international concern on August 14 due to the increase in mpox cases (clade 1 and clade 1b) in Africa, where the virus is circulating intensively. A dozen African countries have reported around 19,000 cases and over 540 deaths since the beginning of 2024, with the current epicenter in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), according to the African public health organization. Sweden confirmed the first case of clade 1b outside of Africa on August 15. The clade 1 and the recent clade 1b are different from the clade 2, which caused a violent outbreak in Africa in 2022 and hundreds of cases in Europe, North America, and other regions. The risk of transmission in Europe is currently low. The Spanish Ministry of Health has recommended maintaining the vaccination strategy only for high-risk groups, such as individuals who engage in high-risk sexual practices or those with occupational risk, and has sufficient stock of doses, including those in the strategic reserve.
news knowledge.title: Tailandia confirma el primer caso en Asia de la nueva variante

news knowledge.eng_title: San Luis Potosí Reports No Cases of Mpox Clade I Variant
news knowledge.summary: The National Epidemiological Surveillance Committee (CONAVE) in Mexico has issued an epidemiological alert regarding the Mpox clade I variant. The Secretary of Health in San Luis Potosí, Ymuri Vaca Avila, stated that the goal is to have medical units across the country monitor and report probable cases to reduce the spread of the disease and provide timely medical attention to those infected. According to Avila, there have been no cases of the Mpox clade I variant in San Luis Potosí this year, and only 10 cases were reported in 2022 and 5 in 2023. The symptoms of the disease include fever, headache, fatigue, muscle pain, and skin lesions, which can appear on the face, hands, and other parts of the body. To confirm a case, a positive result from a real-time PCR test or identification of samples analyzed by the Mexican Institute of Public Health (InDRE) is required. Avila recommended that the population frequently wash their hands, cover their nose and mouth when coughing or sneezing, avoid sharing food and drinks, and use face masks when near an infected person. She also advised to clean and disinfect areas where an infected person has been, avoid close contact, and properly dispose of contaminated items.
news knowledge.title: San Luis Potosí sin casos de nueva variante de viruela símica (Mpox)

news knowledge.eng_title: Mexico Confirms 49 Cases of Mpox, 212 Probable Cases

Event: International Public Health Emergency of International Concern

news knowledge.summary: According to the Mexican Ministry of Health, there have been 49 confirmed cases of Mpox (also known as monkeypox or smallpox) in 11 states of Mexico from January to August 3, 2024. Additionally, there are 212 probable cases of the virus. The National Committee for Epidemiological Surveillance (CONAVE) has published an epidemiological alert regarding Mpox. The alert aims to have medical units across the country monitor and report probable cases to reduce the spread of the virus and provide timely medical attention to those affected. Mexico has a system for monitoring Mpox, which allows for the notification of probable cases through the National Epidemiological Surveillance System. The clade II is the only one detected in all analyzed cases in Mexico so far. The new variant clade 1b has not been identified in the country. The Ministry of Health has a plan in place to address Mpox, which includes national response coordination, community involvement, diagnosis and epidemiological surveillance, comprehensive care, and risk communication. The plan is updated according to the current requirements of the International Public Health Emergency of International Concern (ESPII). The Ministry recommends that the general population take precautions such as frequent handwashing, covering the nose and mouth when coughing or sneezing, avoiding sharing food, drinks, utensils, and plates, and wearing medical masks. They also recommend washing and disinfecting clothing, towels, utensils, and bedding that have come into contact with an infected person, and avoiding contact with lesions and other people if symptoms are present.
news knowledge.title: Se confirman 49 casos de Mpox en México

news knowledge.eng_title: Mexico's Mpox Cases: A Growing Concern

Event: Public Health Emergency of International Concern

news knowledge.summary: As of 2024, there have been 49 confirmed cases of mpox (monkeypox) in Mexico, with none of the new clade 1 or clade 1b strain, but rather clade II. Of these 49 cases, 47 are men and 2 are women. The 49 confirmed cases of mpox were derived from 212 suspected cases. The 11 states with mpox cases are led by Mexico City, which accounts for over 50% of the cases, followed by Quintana Roo and Jalisco. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC) was declared on August 14, 2024. The Mexican Ministry of Health recommends reporting suspected cases to 5519469772 or censida@salud.gob.mx. The ministry also explained the two phases of the disease, which can last from two to four weeks. The first phase includes symptoms such as fever, headache, and muscle pain. The second phase, which appears two to three days after the onset of symptoms, is characterized by the appearance of blisters on the face and then on the rest of the body. To prevent the spread of the disease, it is recommended to avoid contact with others, frequently wash hands, wear a mask, avoid sharing food and utensils, and disinfect areas where the infected person has been. Activists in Mexico are demanding the application of existing vaccines, but the federal government has ignored their requests, citing a 'mediocre' effect, despite other countries applying them to vulnerable groups.
news knowledge.title: Viruela del mono mpox en México: Estos son los estados con más casos

news knowledge.eng_title: Europe Raises Alert Level for Mpox After Case Detected in Sweden

Organization: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control

keywords: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control
news knowledge.summary: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) has raised its risk level for mpox, a day after the World Health Organization (WHO) confirmed a case of infection with the new strain of the virus in Sweden, the first outside of Africa. The director of the ECDC said that there will be more imported cases of the new strain of mpox in Europe in the coming weeks, although the risk of sustained transmission remains low. The WHO declared on Wednesday that mpox is a global health emergency, its highest level of alert, after an outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo that spread to neighboring countries. Mpox, a viral infection that causes pus-filled lesions and symptoms similar to the flu, is usually mild but can be fatal. Two strains are now spreading in the Congo: the endemic form of the virus, clade I, and a new branch called clade Ib. The ECDC raised its risk level for mpox from 'low' to 'moderate' for sporadic cases appearing in the bloc, and asked countries to maintain high levels of awareness among travelers visiting affected areas. 'Due to the close links between Europe and Africa, we must be prepared for more imported cases of clade I,' said ECDC director Pamela Rendi Wagner. Pakistan also confirmed a case of the virus mpox in a patient who had returned from a Gulf country, although it was unclear whether it was the new variant or the clade that has been spreading globally since 2022. WHO official Margaret Harris said in a press conference on Friday that she expects more cases outside of Africa soon, also due to increased surveillance. However, the WHO discouraged any travel restrictions to prevent the spread of the virus.
news knowledge.title: Europa eleva el nivel de alerta por mpox tras caso detectado en Suecia

news knowledge.eng_title: Pakistan confirms first case of Mpox, on traveler returning from the Middle East
news knowledge.summary: Pakistan has confirmed its first case of Mpox in 2024, a day after the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern. The patient, a resident of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa province, started showing symptoms of Mpox days after returning from a Gulf country, with some reports claiming he came from Saudi Arabia and others from the United Arab Emirates. The patient has mild symptoms, and efforts are underway to trace and test those who have been in contact with him. This development comes at a time when Mpox is spreading rapidly across several African countries, and one case has also been reported in Sweden, making it the first European nation to report the infection in 2024. According to Sweden's Health and Social Affairs Minister Jakob Forssmed, 'We have now also during the afternoon had confirmation that we have one case in Sweden of the more grave type of Mpox, the one called Clade I.'
news knowledge.title: Pakistan confirms first case of Mpox, on traveler returning from the Middle East

news knowledge.eng_title: Colombia Confirms No Detection of Clade I Mpox Variant
news knowledge.summary: Colombia's Minister of Health, Guillermo Jaramillo, confirmed that the clade I variant of the Mpox virus has not been detected in the country. According to Jaramillo, the clade I variant has not been found in the Americas, but Colombia has reported over 4,000 cases of infection by the clade II variant of the virus since May 2022, with 109 cases documented in 2024. The majority of cases, 85%, have been reported in Bogotá, Cali, Medellín, and Barranquilla. Jaramillo stated, 'Colombia remains committed to monitoring and controlling Mpox, working in line with international recommendations to protect the health of all our citizens. We will maintain our prevention and response actions to prevent the spread of the virus.'
news knowledge.title: Ministro de Salud confirmó que variante clado I de la viruela símica no ha sido detectada en Colombia

news knowledge.eng_title: Sweden confirms a case of mpox  --  the first reported infection of the strain outside of Africa
news knowledge.summary: Sweden has confirmed its first case of the more contagious version of mpox, known as Clade I, which is currently circulating in central and eastern Africa. According to Health and Social Affairs Minister Jakob Forssmed, 'We have now also during the afternoon had confirmation that we have one case in Sweden of the more grave type of mpox, the one called Clade I.' The Public Health Agency of Sweden stated that the patient, who spent time in Africa, sought care in Stockholm after being infected with the Clade I strain. This strain is 'likely to be associated with a higher risk of a more severe course of disease and higher mortality,' and is transmissible via routine close contact, such as between household members. This is a notable difference from the Clade II strain, which was transmitted primarily via sexual contact among men who have sex with men during the 2022 outbreak.
news knowledge.title: Sweden confirms a case of mpox  --  the first reported infection of the strain outside of Africa

news knowledge.eng_title: Mexico Confirms 49 Cases of Mpox, No New Clade 1b Variant Detected

Event: International Public Health Emergency of Importance

news knowledge.summary: The Mexican Ministry of Health reported 49 confirmed cases of Mpox (formerly known as monkeypox) in 11 states across the country from January to August 3, 2024. The National Epidemiological Surveillance Committee (CONAVE) also reported 212 probable cases of the virus. The CONAVE published an epidemiological alert to raise awareness among healthcare units across the country to report and monitor cases, reducing the risk of transmission and providing timely medical attention to affected individuals. The alert noted that Mexico has a Mpox surveillance system, which allows for the notification of probable cases through the National Epidemiological Surveillance System platform. The confirmed cases in Mexico have only been identified as clade II, with no cases of the new clade 1b variant detected. The country has a Response Plan for Mpox, which includes coordination, community involvement, diagnosis, and communication. The plan is updated according to the current requirements of the International Public Health Emergency of Importance (ESPII), which has been activated in response to the alert. The symptoms of Mpox typically last for two to four weeks and include fever, intense headache, swollen lymph nodes, back pain, muscle pain, and a lack of energy. The disease progresses in two stages, with the first stage characterized by fever, headache, and swollen lymph nodes, and the second stage marked by the appearance of small blisters and a rash that spreads from the face to the rest of the body. The Ministry of Health recommends that the general population take precautions such as frequent handwashing, covering the nose and mouth when coughing or sneezing, avoiding sharing food and drinks, and wearing medical masks. They also recommend washing and disinfecting clothing, utensils, and bedding that have come into contact with an infected person, and avoiding contact with lesions and other people if symptoms are present.
news knowledge.title: Se confirman 49 casos de Mpox en México; ninguno tenía la nueva variante clado 1b

news knowledge.eng_title: MinSalud Announces Actions in Response to MPOX Declaration in Africa
news knowledge.summary: The Ministry of Health announced that it will take actions in response to the World Health Organization's declaration of a public health emergency of international concern for MPOX in Africa. These actions include: strengthening and deploying specific risk communication strategies, advancing coordination with the Pan American Health Organization to ensure vaccine availability, intensifying public health surveillance for diseases that cause visible skin lesions, and strengthening capacities for detection, diagnosis, and treatment. The National Institute of Health will continue and reinforce laboratory and genomic surveillance of Mpox. Additionally, the ministry is alerting health institutions, insurance companies, and territorial health entities to increase promotion, prevention, and early detection of the disease. It is worth noting that, according to health authorities, no cases of the Monkey Pox type (clade I) have been identified in Colombia, which affects Africa. However, Colombia has reported 4,257 confirmed cases of Mpox (clade II) with a peak of cases during the ESPII declaration in 2022, and 109 confirmed cases in 2024, with 2 active cases and no reported deaths. The Ministry of Health, the National University of Colombia, and the Government of Japan have been working since 2022 on the study of the effectiveness, safety, and immunogenicity of the Japanese vaccine against Mpox. Both clades of the virus can be spread through direct contact with infected wild animals, close contact, including intimate or sexual contact with an infected person, or contact with contaminated materials.
news knowledge.title: MinSalud anuncia acciones frente a la declaratoria de emergencia de MPOX en África
